name: Spicy Balsamic-Glazed Chicken Wings
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: I'm a huge fan of Buffalo wings but was wanting to try something different for a change. These wings are tangy, spicy, sticky, and just a little bit sweet. Have plenty of napkins ready before you dig in!
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper
Place wings on the baking sheet and sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon salt
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes
Using tongs, flip the wings over and sprinkle remaining salt over the top
Meanwhile, bring water, vinegar, sweet chili sauce, and Sriracha to a boil in a medium saucepan
Reduce heat and simmer until sauce thickens, about 5 minutes
Transfer wings to a large bowl and pour sauce over the top
Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and turn broiler on high
Place a wire cooling rack on the baking sheet and arrange wings on top
Broil wings for until crispy, about 5 minutes
